content: 28 32 26 instep stitches sm across 28 32 36 stitches as follows k1 ssk k to 3 stitches before second marker k2tog k1 sm row 1 * sl 1 k 1 repeat from * to end turn to back row 2 knit all stitches row 2 sl 1 p to end turn to front repeat row 1 and 2 until 56 64 72 stitches remain repeat row 1 & 2 13 15 15 more times for a total ending on row 2 of 28 32 32 row ending with row 2 if needed rearrange stitches so that the 28 32 26 if you would like a higher instep repeat row 1 & 2 a instep stitches are on one needle and the 28 32 36 few more times keep track of the number of row that sole/bottom of foot stitches are on the other needle you work here foot turn heel continue in stockinette stitch until foot measured from back of heel is approximately 1½ 1¾ 2 inches starting on right front side shorter than desired length row 1 sl1 k 16 18 20 ssk k1 turn row 2 sl 1 p 7 p2tog p1 turn note i like to knit socks with a little negative ease - row 3 sl 1 k to 1 stitch before gap ssk k1 turn my total sock length is about ¼ - ½ inch shorter than row 4 sl 1 p to one stitch before gap actual foot length p2tog p1 turn toe repeat row 3 & 4 until all stitches have been worked ending on row 4 i prefer to knit a rounded wedge toe it looks more like a commercial sock and seems to fit a little better set up gusset row 1 on needle 1 k1 ssk k to last 3 stitches on instep k2tog k1 continuing right side knit across the heel stitches on needle 1 and pick up 15 17 17 gusset stitchesº plus on needle 2 k1 ssk k to last 3 stitches on one extra stitch in the space between the heel flap and bottom of foot k2tog k1 the instep pm knit across the 28 32 36 instep stitches on needle 2 pm pick up one stitch in the row 2 k all stitches space between the instep and the heel flap and then pick up 15 17 17 gusset stitches º repeat row 1 and 2 4 5 6 more times for a total of 10 12 14 row and 36 40 44 stitches remain º the number changes if you worked more than 28 32 32 row on the heel flap then repeat row 1 only 4 4 5 more times until 20 general rule here is divide the number of 24 24 stitches remain you should now have 10 12 heel flap row by 2 and add 1 to determine 12 stitches on both needles number of gusset stitches for each side graft these remaining stitches together using the next knit
